content:
Modify OmniScript UI Behavior

Behavior options include:

* Hide or show elements and errors conditionally
* Hide Next and Previous buttons
* Trigger events

Use the Conditional View Property to Conditionally Display Elements:
Every element supports at least one Conditional View, allowing you to hide the element or group based on conditions.

Hide OmniScript Elements:
Use the Hide property to hide elements and child elements using OmniScript Input Components, Blocks, Steps, Groups, Formulas, and Aggregate elements.

Hide the Next and Previous Buttons:
Hide a Step's Next and Previous buttons when using auto-advance options or not wanting users to navigate steps.

Display Messages in OmniScripts:
Display comments, requirements, success, and warning messaging based on validate expression results. Configure the Messaging element to display validation messages.

Fire Platform Events from OmniScripts:
Fire Salesforce platform events from an OmniScript context.

Set Errors In an OmniScript:
Put error or validation messaging on elements based on conditions using the Set Errors action element.
title: Modify OmniScript UI Behavior
